subject: Re: [junit] how to set up ant to run the junit task?
msgSnippet: I placed the optional.jar file into my /lib and am getting the following message: unit: BUILD FAILED /home/peterb/Java/PSSGLib_1_0_2/build.xml:219:
messageBody:
I placed the optional.jar file into my <ANT_HOME>/lib and am getting the
following message:

unit:

BUILD FAILED

/home/peterb/Java/PSSGLib_1_0_2/build.xml:219: Could not create task of
type: junit because I can't find it in the list of task class definitions.
Common solutions are: 1 execute bin/bootstrap. 2 use taskdef to declare your
task. 3 add the task to defaults.properties.

Here is the blurb from the build.xml file:


<target name="junit" depends="build"
description="Complete of all JUnit test suites called
'PackageTest'">
<junit printsummary="${testsummary}" haltonerror="on"
haltonfailure="on">
<formatter type="${testformat}" usefile="${usefile}"/>
<batchtest>
<fileset dir="${destdir}">
<include name="**/Test_Package.class"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>
</target>


----- Original Message -----
From: "John Brewer" <jbrewer@...>
To: <junit@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 25, 2001 7:41 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] how to set up ant to run the junit task?


> At 06:58 PM 1/25/01 , Peter Bismuti wrote:
> >
> > How do you set up Ant to run the junit task? I have the optional.jar
file.
> > A reference to some docs would be sufficient.
>
>
> Just place "optional.jar" into <ANT_HOME>/lib. The ant launcher scripts,
like
> "ant.bat", include all jar files in that directory on the classpath when
> running ant.
>
> If you got the release version of Ant, the docs should have been installed
in
> <ANT_HOME>/docs. You want "junit.html". There's also a link to it from
> "index.html", at the bottom of the page, under "Optional Packages".
>
> John Brewer
> Jera Design
>
> To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> junit-unsubscribe@egroups.com
>
>
